column3: If playing fast, at 2048 I usually unattentionaly choose button 'new game'. Really annoying that you can not undo that. No idea what are benefits of placing that question at all???!
Accidential game resets when combined 2048 and swiping while "Would you like to continue" screen not yet visible. Please fix it. It's very frustrating to lose progress all the time
Addictively simple yet satisfying. Anyone know the maximum score possible? I got to 131072, but the following day it had reset to zero

High score zero The latest update zeroed out my high score. I had a killer game going too with a 16384 tile, an 8192 tile, and a 2048 tile across the top (love that undo button). I was going to take a screen shot but now I'll just have to start over.
Now differently broken.  Randomly quits. Very annoying  was:Last update broke it. Now main square randomly jumps up and down.

Too easy and too slow Being able to undo just one move should be enough to correct false moves, 50 is ridiculous and makes the game annoyingly slow. 3 moves and everybody is happy, yes? Oh and the occasional dropping of 4 has ruined many a game. The undo button took me from a high score of 73000ish to 290552 in one game,...Full ReviewBeing able to undo just one move should be enough to correct false moves, 50 is ridiculous and makes the game annoyingly slow. 3 moves and everybody is happy, yes? Oh and the occasional dropping of 4 has ruined many a game. The undo button took me from a high score of 73000ish to 290552 in one game, finally defeated by a dropped 4.

Slow Since latest update, it's moving very slow.  The animations are fine, but the time it takes from my finger movement to display is too slow.  I was already moving ahead of the animations before, but now I don't even want to play due to the latency.
Good idea. +1 for Open Source.  Edit: Cannot stand blurriness anymore.
Addiction maximized My daughter (a Mathie)  told me about this game.  I am happy there is an undo button now.  I wish this version were available for the Kindle.
Fundamental flaw Sometimes drops a 4 instead of a 2.  I suspect the error is in the source code because another ad free version does the same.  A bothersome glitch.
Keeps crashing Since I upgraded my android this game keeps crashing.

Addictive I first became a fan of this game when i got an app that u had to earn coins to unlock diffrent colored lights. How u got coins was to play games and it just happened tbat one of the mini games was this kind of game!!!

Great for just playing the game I just installed and played about five times already. I really like that there are no pop-ups or ads. The only thing that was a little bothersome was the slight lag in the moving of the tiles. It's not even that big of a deal.

Great  implementation Perfect, except that the "try again" button can easily be pressed accidentally upon reaching 2048 tile, thus resetting the game. Also the "keep trying" button is registered as a move when pressed, repeating the last move.
Perfect version There many versions of this game out there. This one is the best! No ads, no nagging. A clean and faithful port of the original!
Great app, lots of fun This is a perfect port of 2048 without ads or any undesirable "features" included. It might not have an undo feature but that just makes you a better player IMO. Great app!

As it should be A simple implementation that just works, minimalistic and without unnecessary app permissions, as should be customary for more simple games and apps. Kudos to the devs for giving the right example!

Only minor problems Love that it requires no permissions. Input is smooth and smart. HATE how when I hit 2048 it asks if I want to continue. Can't tell you how many times I've hit NO because I'm doing my next move, and I have to start over. Also when you get a really high score (150k in my case) , on future games the s...Full ReviewLove that it requires no permissions. Input is smooth and smart. HATE how when I hit 2048 it asks if I want to continue. Can't tell you how many times I've hit NO because I'm doing my next move, and I have to start over. Also when you get a really high score (150k in my case) , on future games the score boxes and game grid pop up and down as the score width changes.

Good overall but problem with randomness I can get to 4096 if moving towards top left but not if I move towards bottom left. Tiles seem more likely to appear near the bottom so regularly fill up gaps in the build area which make it hard to win in that direction! I've played other versions and the difference in resulting gameplay is quite e...Full ReviewI can get to 4096 if moving towards top left but not if I move towards bottom left. Tiles seem more likely to appear near the bottom so regularly fill up gaps in the build area which make it hard to win in that direction! I've played other versions and the difference in resulting gameplay is quite evident.
Simply addictive Bare bones time eater without any hidden bloat or unnecessary permissions. I just wish there was a high score tracker that can chart my progress.

But the last update.... Love this game and the fact that it doesn't require any special permissions, but the last update deeply affects playability.  On my nexus 5 it doesn't recognize upward swipes most of the time.  Left, right, and downward work normally.
Changing review from 5 to 1 star The update had killed the game. The touch controls are utterly unresponsive. What have you done developers.This was my favorite game. HTC one m7 user here.

A Simple and Clean 2048 Implementation When my kids were falling to the frenzy of 2048, I searched for the simplest app closest in implementation to the original website.  This seems to be it!  My only gripe is the Game Over text covers the tiles so I can't get good screenshots of my highest ones...

Fun but last update Last update seems to have changed the sensitivity of the screen. Moves have to be more deliberate to take effect. Sometimes it takes several attempts before a move will register and happen. Previous version was much better.
Its 2048 after all! Who dislikes it. This particular app is interesting because it doesn't ask for any special purposes. But then, a little more snappy please?

Great app and game But takes up a lot of your battery... Would not recommend playing if you're on a long journey and need battery for long hours. Would rate it 5 star if it doesn't drain battery life. Xperia Z1 compact
Fun but. Really like the no permissions and its fun but It feels like there is a delay when I make a move. The area of play is too small. Going to install a different app.
Sensitivity issues There are issues with sensitivty of swiping since it was updated. It sometimes lags or takes a few tries to swipe the tiles. Galaxy s4
CLAMF Every time I get 1024 the screen mysteriously becomes hypersensitive and the slightest brush sends the tiles caroming.  Once or twice is my fault, every time has to be an error.
Best for requiring no permissions A big thank you to the developer(s) for producing a simple version of this game that requires no special permissions.  Down with leaderboards!

Love the game, but... ...something happened on the last update. I now have to swipe several times for the motion to register. It isn't all the time, but it's enough that I get frustrated and often back out of the app to try again later. Otherwise, I love this game.
Love it Thank you developer. This is the only 2048 game that doesn't require permission to read any content on my device.

What free games should be This app is lightweight, works really well, and doesn't bombard you with nonsense. Play the game, save state when you close the app, and always responsive. Take notes, game developers!

A good addictive game Gets a little boring once you've worked out how to solve it though. Also steals battery and can lag since it some how manages to use 100% of the cpu when active, which it should not do. Mostly marked it down because of this, it limits play time.

Simple, no ads, clean interface. Time to look for a way to throw a couple bucks at the Dev(s?).  Only concern is that sometimes the long click that gets out of full screen gets triggered accidentally while I'm thinking, but that's my problem, not theirs.

Annoying popup I often accidentally restart the game when I hit 2048. Would be better if the popup was not on the main stage when you reach 2048. Or just have the option to never have that message show up.
Too power hungry Love the game. It makes time and my battery disappear. Like no ads and permissions but wish it left some power for phone calls.

No adverts but very laggy Great game play but game gets slower and slower as you play it to the point of being unplayable and frustrating - repeatedly sliding and waiting for a response. Sorry have had to uninstall it

Good game, but has some programming issues. The game itself is fun. Its the only version, to my knowledge, that doesn't require permissions, but it does have response-time issues. It's easier just to go on my browser and play it on the website than to deal with the app's unresponsive game play.

One Direction Although praiseworthy for being light on resources, there is a bug so major I felt I have had to do something I rarely do - leave a rating. Sometimes the game refuses to respond to any swipe except one in a particular direction, and that direction may well be one which you do not wish to take, and t...Full ReviewAlthough praiseworthy for being light on resources, there is a bug so major I felt I have had to do something I rarely do - leave a rating. Sometimes the game refuses to respond to any swipe except one in a particular direction, and that direction may well be one which you do not wish to take, and thus you are compelled to do something that will sabotage your momentum and/or strategy.
Nice and Simple.  No Permissions needed! Gotta love it when a dev gets it right.  Just wish I could get back all the hours I've lost to this game.
